name: unachievable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unachievable task, ambition, etc. is one that is impossible to achieve: Cheap, pesticide-free food is probably an unachievable objective. Engineering limitations rendered the goal unachievable. Opposite
achievable
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
not able to be achievedimpossibleThere's no way we'll be able to get the paperwork done in time – it's impossible. unachievableThere is no point in setting unachievable goals for yourself.unattainableThese bodybuilders are chasing an unattainable ideal – they'll never be as muscular as they want.unfeasibleIt would be unfeasible to try to ban all petrol vehicles at the moment.infeasibleThe company has promised a fully self-driving car in a year, but engineers say it is technically infeasible.
See more results »
More examplesFewer examplesThe professionals feared setting an unachievable target.It may be an unachievable goal, but you set your targets as high as you possibly can.In practice, the estimates are unachievable and homeworkers earn much less.

not able to be done, reached, or finished successfully: Doubling our sales figures in the next year is an unachievable goal. Many critics believe that unbiased journalism is unachievable.
